remarks:
Jusqu'á ce jour la fréquence de notification de cas de Tuberculose est trimestrielle.  Le total accumulé  de nouveaux cas de tuberculose et de rechute (toutes formes confondues) qui ont été notifiés  pendant la période de janvier à juin 2020 est de  30. 231 dont 93 cas de Tuberculose pharmaco-résistante repris en deux trimestres, au premier trimestre 17.213 dont 59 TBMDR et au deuxième trimestre 13.018 dont 34 TBMDR.
Données partielles 14 provinces sur 18 et seront actualisées

Brazil does not use an online information system for TB, so, the decrease in the total number of TB cases (new and relapses) notified in the latest months of 2020 is virtual, and due to the outdated information system.

Q1 - 33886 and Q2 - 21895. According to routine recording and reporting system, NTP can provided quarterly data only. As soon as COVID-19 confirmed case was detected in country on 23 March, there was a significant decline in TB case notification as a result of ACF activities suspension and COVID-19 response measures like stay home and travel restrictions. It was leading to 34% decline in case notification compared to previous year (Apr- Jun) achievement.
Data for February 2021 still under reporting on HMIS. All the data reported in the system were collected form HMIS.
The data were collected from both the NTIP program and report of the private or non MoPH health facilities.

Updated 2021-07-01 by Hazim Timimi (WHO/Geneva) based on feedback remarks made during the 2021 data collection round. Previously the numbers were 445, 348, 382 and 386, i.e. significantly lower than the final figures

These are the numbers of reported pulmonary TB cases sourced from the monthly communicable disease surveillance reports of the China CDC. They have been multiplied by a factor of 0.7019 to account for the historical relationship between reported cases and the final number of notified cases for the period 2017-2019 (annually rather than monthly data)

These monthly TB notification data are based on DHIS2 TB Tracker which has started in 2019 and is in the transition period, therefore data entry performance is around 80%. Its coverage has not been changed much during these six months, thus these data could show the trend.

The drop in April probably is due to possible less access to TB diagnosis and under-reporting by the impact of Covid 19 and lockdown between April 1st and May 17th.

The NTP is not able to provide the information. The national department of health is under lockdown and the M&E officers were not able to access the office to encode Q2 reports by August 06, which is the deadline for submission. In addition, reporting for drug-susceptible TB is quarterly while drug-resistant TB is semi-annual, and therefore, it is not possible to provide the requested number of notified cases by month.

country: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

remarks: The data are preliminary
Provisional data of Jan-April 2021 submitted. Data extracted from Nikshay as of 10/05/2021.

There were 5700 new and relapse notified TB cases reported from 61 out of 329 NTP TBC and 6 out of 9 implementing partners. There was no reported data from any Public-public Mix hospitals, Mandatory Hospitals, and some implementing partners (MAM, MDM, MATA) as of 29th Apr 2021. Myanmar is currently facing a health system failure due to civil unrest as well as internet access limitation.
The data was extracted from the National TB Information Program (?NTIP) on June 25, 2021.

These are the numbers of reported pulmonary TB cases sourced from the monthly communicable disease surveillance reports of the China CDC. They have been multiplied by a factor of 0.7019 to account for the historical relationship between reported cases and the final number of notified cases for the period 2017-2019 (annually rather than monthly data)
For April, May and June 2021: Data not yet ready available.
